docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This property will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-members-backend.currentMember.getMember()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-members-backend/currentmember/getmember).
description: Gets the member's ID.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this property is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-members-backend.currentMember.getMember()`](wix-members-backend/currentmember/getMember).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { currentMember } from 'wix-members-backend'
> 2. If you plan to migrate all functions that use `wixUsersBackend`,
>    remove the original `import wixUsersBackend` statement.
> 3. Look for any code that uses `wixUsersBackend.currentUser`,
>    and replace it with `currentMember.getMember()`.
>    Update your code to work with the new `getMember()`
>    call and response properties.
>    The ID property is in the returned member object as `_id`.
> 4. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.

extra.description: This example uses a deprecated object.

docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This property will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-members-backend.currentMember.getMember()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-members-backend/currentmember/getmember).
description: Indicates whether the member is logged in or not.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this property is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-members-backend.currentMember.getMember()`](wix-members-backend/currentmember/getMember).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { currentMember } from 'wix-members-backend'
> 2. If you plan to migrate all functions that use `wixUsersBackend`,
>    remove the original `import wixUsersBackend` statement.
> 3. Look for any code that uses `wixUsersBackend.currentUser`,
>    and replace it with `currentMember.getMember()`.
>    Update your code to work with the new `getMember()`
>    call and response properties.
>    - If a member is logged in, the member object is returned.
>    - If no member is logged in, a response of `undefined` is returned.
> 4. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
Gets one of the following:
+ `true` — The user is logged in.
+ `false` — The user is not logged in.

extra.description: This example uses a deprecated object.

docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This function will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-members-backend.currentMember.getRoles()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-members-backend/currentmember/getroles).
description: Gets the member's role.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this function is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-members-backend.currentMember.getRoles()`](wix-members-backend/currentmember/getRoles).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { currentMember } from 'wix-members-backend'
> 2. If you plan to migrate all functions that use `wixUsersBackend`,
>    remove the original `import wixUsersBackend` statement.
> 3. Look for any code that uses `wixUsersBackend.currentUser`,
>    and replace it with `currentMember.getRoles()`.
>    Update your code to work with the new `getRoles()`
>    call and response properties.
> 4. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
Gets one of the following roles:
+ `"Admin"` — The owner of the site.
+ `"Member"` — A user who is logged in.
+ `"Visitor"` — A user who is not logged in.

extra.description: This example uses a deprecated object.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The email address of the user that is logged in.
Rejected - Message containing error that the current user is not logged in.

docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This function will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-members-backend.currentMember.getMember()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-members-backend/currentmember/getmember).
description: Gets the email of the current user.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this function is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-members-backend.currentMember.getMember()`](wix-members-backend/currentmember/getMember).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { currentMember } from 'wix-members-backend'
> 2. If you plan to migrate all functions that use `wixUsersBackend`,
>    remove the original `import wixUsersBackend` statement.
> 3. Look for any code that uses `wixUsersBackend.currentUser`,
>    and replace it with `currentMember.getMember()`.
>    Update your code to work with the new `getMember()`
>    call and response properties.
>    To return emails, you must specify the `"FULL"` fieldset.
>    The login email property is in the returned member object as `loginEmail`.
>    If the member has any additional emails, they are in the
>    `contactDetails.emails` array.
> 4. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
The `getEmail()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the email address
of the user that is logged in or rejects if the current user is not logged in.

extra.description: This example uses a deprecated object.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The user's pricing plans.
Rejected - Error message.

docs.summary: Gets the current member's pricing plan.
description: The `getPricingPlans()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the
[pricing plans](https://support.wix.com/en/article/adding-and-setting-up-the-paid-plans-app)
of the user that is logged in or rejects if the current user is not logged in.
[Pricing plans](https://support.wix.com/en/article/adding-and-setting-up-the-paid-plans-app)
help you manage which site members can access which pages.

extra.description: This example uses a deprecated object.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The user's roles.
Rejected - Error message.

docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This function will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-members-backend.currentMember.getRoles()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-members-backend/currentmember/getroles).
description: Gets the user's member roles.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this function is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-members-backend.currentMember.getRoles()`](wix-members-backend/currentmember/getRoles).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { currentMember } from 'wix-members-backend'
> 2. If you plan to migrate all functions that use `wixUsersBackend`,
>    remove the original `import wixUsersBackend` statement.
> 3. Look for any code that uses `wixUsersBackend.currentUser.getRoles()`,
>    and replace it with `currentMember.getRoles()`.
>    Update your code to work with the new `getRoles()`
>    call and response properties.
> 4. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
The `getRoles()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the [roles](https://support.wix.com/en/article/creating-member-roles-6943237) of
the user that is logged in or rejects if the current user is not logged in.
The following is returned when the user is:
+ A logged-in member: The promise resolves to the member's roles or an empty
array if the member has not been assigned any roles.
+ The site owner: The promise resolves to the admin's roles with an additional
role containing the `name` "Admin".
+ A non logged-in visitor: The Promise is rejected.

extra.description: This example uses a deprecated object.

docs.summary: An object returned by the `getPricingPlans()` function representing a user's [pricing plans](https://support.wix.com/en/article/adding-and-setting-up-the-paid-plans-app).
An object returned by the `getRoles()` function representing a user's [roles](https://support.wix.com/en/article/creating-member-roles-6943237).

members.name: name
members.doc: Role name as defined in the site's dashboard or one of "Admin" or "Member".

members.name: description
members.doc: Role description, if defined in the site's dashboard.
